cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: eye moving over the Camaguey Archipelago of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: continuing west along the north coast of Cuba, then turning northwest to north-northwest toward the Florida Keys Sunday morning and up the southwest coast of Florida thereafter
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Keys and subsequently near Naples / southwest Florida coast

weather_observation.under_warning: Hurricane Warning (also under Storm Surge Warning)
weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch north of the Volusia/Brevard County Line to Fernandina Beach and north/west of Anclote River to Indian Pass
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Volusia/Brevard County Line southward around the entire Florida peninsula to Anclote River, including Florida Keys, Lake Okeechobee and Florida Bay; Storm Surge Warning Volusia/Brevard County Line southward around the peninsula to Anclote River including Tampa Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida peninsula – east coast (including Miami), Keys, and southwest Gulf coast
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood of sustained tropical-storm to hurricane-force winds; 27% chance of 64-kt (74-mph) hurricane winds, peak onset probability 30 h from advisory time
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential 5–10 ft surge from Cape Sable to Boca Raton, which includes the Miami metropolitan shoreline
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–15 inches with isolated totals to 20 inches possible over southeast Florida producing life-threatening flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes beginning Saturday midday; dangerous surf and rip currents affecting vessel approaches and berth areas
